whiskeyName: Wild Turkey Forgiven Bourbon and Rye
description: Wild Turkey Forgiven is a blend of 78% six-year-old bourbon and 22% four-year-old rye whiskies. Apparently initially produced due to a mix-up at the distillery, the result was so good they decided to release it.
Widow Jane's Rye Mash has lighter notes of spice than most rye whiskeys, this has notes of maple, almond, apricot and white pepper.
Pow-wow gets its name from an old Algonquin (a rarely spoken Canadian language) word for gathering. This is a rye whiskey is infused with botanicals including saffron and orange peel.

Originally launched as a limited-edition travel-retail exclusive, Jack Daniel's No.27 Gold gained a wider release in Autumn 2015. Initially matured in virgin American white oak casks, it's been finished in maple-wood barrels and twice filtered though maple-wood charcoal, it's rich with extra notes of maple.

whiskeyName: Tullahoma (George Dickel) 2011 Bot.2016 Malts of Scotland
description: Independent bottlings of George Dickel are rarely seen. This release from German independent bottler Malts of Scotland has been named Tullahoma, after the city where the distillery is located.

whiskeyName: Jack Daniel's Old No.7 Half Bottle
description: A half bottle of Jack Daniel's best selling old no.7 Tennessee Whiskey, famous worldwide thanks to the sweet smoothness imparted by the Lincoln County Process of charcoal-mellowing the spirit before maturation.

whiskeyName: Michter's US*1 Barrel Strength Straight Rye (54.6%)
description: After the success of Michter's US*1 Single Barrel Straight Rye, they have added a cask-strength version. This bottling, at 54.6%, is big and toasty, with notes of vanilla, caramel, and the spiciness one expects from rye whiskey.We cannot guarantee specific barrel number or year of release of these bottles.
An old bottle of Seagram's VO Canadian whisky, which was bottled in 1983.

whiskeyName: Jim Beam White Label and 2 Glasses Gift Pack
description: Jim Beam White Label has been made to the same formula since 1795 and is aged for four years in oak barrels to create a smooth, mellow taste with hints of spice. It is presented here with a pair of glasses.
A four-year-old straight bourbon produced by Jim Beam at their distillery in Clermont, Kentucky. This young bourbon is versatile and can either be drunk neat, as part of a long drink or in cocktails.
Early Times is a Kentucky bourbon from the Brown-Forman portfolio. With a high percentage of corn in the blend, Old Reserve is light and sweet with rich caramel notes.
Reintroduced after a 20-year absence, I W Harper is a historic brand of Kentucky bourbon. Aged for 12 years, this is light and sweet with notes of toffee, butterscotch, orange zest and vanilla.

whiskeyName: Pikesville 6 Year Old 110 Proof Straight Rye Heaven Hill
description: A high-strength rye from Heaven Hill in Kentucky, Pikesville 110 is a sweet and spicy whiskey with notes of liquorice, coconut, vanilla and cinnamon.
A small-batch bourbon from the first legal distillery in Texas, Garrison Brothers. Distilled in 2012, this was aged for three years and released in 2015.

whiskeyName: Old Potrero 18th Century Style Rye Spirit
description: An excellent rye from Old Potrero, this is a truly exceptional and unique example of rye whisky as it was originally made in the 18th Century.

This gift set from Seattle's Westland contains three 20cl bottles; one each of the classic American Single Malts, Peated and Sherry Oak. A great gift for whisky lovers who like to explore outside of Scotland.
Wild Turkey has created a monumental single barrel bourbon. A seductive bouquet and seemingly endless body
Magnificent stuff from Heaven Hill that really is worth hunting for.
bonded
Amber, with a golden cast. Medium-bodied. Reminiscent of clove, citrus, smoke, dried herbs. Buttery, smooth texture. Attractive in its viscosity and warmth of the palate.
About as complete a bourbon aroma as you are likely to find...one of the most beautiful noses found anywhere in the world today. A bourbon to keep in the mouth forever.
